Snakes are cold-blooded reptiles that depend on the heat from their surroundings...
...to control the temperature of their bodies.
This is why most snakes are found in tropical regions of the world.
There are no snakes in Iceland, Greenland and Antarctica.
The venom of the king cobra, the world's largest poisonous snake,...
...is strong enough to kill an elephant.
...and can swallow a prey three times larger than their mouth.
Snakes shed their skins every once in a while so they are usually very, very clean.
